text: Return on Tangible Common Equity (ROTCE) was 21%.
CET1 capital ratios were 15.0% for Standard (Std.) and 15.3% for Advanced (Adv.).
Total Loss-Absorbing Capacity was $520B.
Standardized Risk-Weighted Assets (Std. RWA) were $1.7T.
Cash and marketable securities were $1.5T.
Average loans were $1.3T.
1Q24 net income of $13.4B and EPS of $4.44.
Excluding a $725mm increase to the FDIC special assessment, 1Q24 net income was $14.0B, with an EPS of $4.63 and ROTCE of 22%.
Managed revenue was $42.5B.
Expense was $22.8B and the managed overhead ratio was 53%.
Average loans were $1.3T, up 16% YoY and flat QoQ.
Excluding First Republic (FR), average loans were $1.2T, up 3% YoY and flat QoQ.
Average deposits were $2.4T, up 2% YoY and flat QoQ.
Excluding FR, average deposits were $2.3T, flat YoY and QoQ.
CET1 capital was $258B, with a Standardized CET1 capital ratio of 15.0% and an Advanced CET1 capital ratio of 15.3%.
Common dividend was $3.3B or $1.15 per share.
$2.0B of common stock net repurchases were made.
Net payout for the last twelve months (LTM) was 42%.
Memo: NII excluding Markets was $23.0B.
Memo: NIR excluding Markets was $11.5B.
Memo: Markets revenue was $8.0B.
Memo: Adjusted expense was $22.8B.
Memo: Adjusted overhead ratio was 54%.
Excluding First Republic (ex. FR), net income was $4.4B, down 15% YoY.
Ex. FR revenue was $16.6B, up 1% YoY, largely driven by higher net interest income.
Ex. FR expense was $8.8B, up 9% YoY, driven by higher compensation, technology, and marketing investments.
Ex. FR credit costs were $1.9B, with Net Charge-Offs (NCOs) of $1.9B, up $825mm YoY, driven by continued normalization in Card Services.
Ex. FR net reserve build was $45mm, driven by a $153mm build in Card Services, largely offset by a $100mm release in Home Lending.
Ex. FR: Average loans were up 6% YoY and flat QoQ.
Ex. FR: Average deposits were down 7% YoY and 1% QoQ, while End-of-Period (EOP) deposits were down 7% YoY and up 1% QoQ.
Ex. FR: Active mobile customers were up 7% YoY.
Ex. FR: Debit & credit card sales volume was up 9% YoY.
Ex. FR: Client investment assets were up 25% YoY and 7% QoQ.
Net income was $4.8B, up 8% YoY, with revenue of $13.6B, flat YoY.
Investment Banking revenue was $2.0B, up 27% YoY, driven by higher debt and equity underwriting fees.
Payments revenue was $2.4B, down 1% YoY, due to deposit margin compression.
Lending revenue was $130mm, down 51% YoY, due to mark-to-market losses on hedges.
Markets revenue was $8.0B, down 5% YoY.
Fixed Income Markets revenue was $5.3B, down 7% YoY, due to lower activity in Rates and Commodities.
Equity Markets revenue was $2.7B, flat YoY.
Securities Services revenue was $1.2B, up 3% YoY.
Expense was $7.2B, down 4% YoY, driven by lower legal expense.
Excluding First Republic (ex. FR), net income was $1.6B, up 21% YoY.
Ex. FR revenue was $3.6B, up 3% YoY, driven by higher noninterest revenue.
Ex. FR Investment Banking and Markets revenue was $913mm, up 4% YoY.
Ex. FR Payments revenue was $1.9B, down 2% YoY, driven by lower deposit margins and balances.
Ex. FR expense was $1.5B, up 13% YoY, driven by higher compensation and technology investments.
Ex. FR credit costs were a net benefit of $35mm, reflecting a net reserve release of $101mm.
Ex. FR average loans were $241B, up 1% YoY and flat QoQ.
Ex. FR average deposits were $259B, down 3% YoY, primarily due to lower non-operating deposits.
Excluding First Republic (ex. FR), net income was $1.0B, down 26% YoY.
Ex. FR revenue of $4.7B was down 1% YoY, reflecting net investment valuation gains in the prior year.
Excluding valuation gains, revenue (ex. FR) was up 5% YoY, driven by higher management fees on strong net inflows.
Ex. FR expense of $3.4B was up 11% YoY, largely driven by higher compensation and distribution fees.
Assets under management (AUM) of $3.6T were up 19% YoY and client assets of $5.2T were up 20% YoY, driven by higher market levels and continued net inflows.
For the quarter, AUM had long-term net inflows of $34B.
Ex. FR average loans of $213B were up 1% YoY and down 1% QoQ.
Ex. FR average deposits of $215B were down 4% YoY and flat QoQ.
Excluding First Republic (ex. FR), revenue was $2.3B, up $1.3B YoY.
Ex. FR net interest income was $2.5B, up $737mm YoY, driven by the impact of balance sheet mix and higher rates.
Ex. FR noninterest revenue was a net loss of $188mm, compared with a net loss of $755mm in the prior year.
The current quarter included $366mm of net investment securities losses, compared with $868mm of net securities losses in the prior year.
Ex. FR expense of $1.0B, was up $889mm YoY, predominantly driven by an increase to the FDIC special assessment.
Expect FY2024 net interest income of ~$90B, market dependent.
Expect FY2024 net interest income excluding Markets of ~$89B, market dependent.
Expect FY2024 adjusted expense of ~$91B, market dependent.
The adjusted expense forecast includes the increase to the FDIC special assessment in 1Q24.
Expect FY2024 Card Services NCO rate of <3.50%.
The Firm reviews results on a "managed" basis, a non-GAAP measure which adjusts for the tax-equivalent impact of tax-exempt income to allow for comparability of revenue from year-to-year.

Net interest income (NII) and noninterest revenue (NIR) excluding Markets are non-GAAP metrics used to assess the performance of the Firm's core lending, investing, and deposit-raising activities, apart from the volatility of Markets activities.

First-quarter 2024 net income, EPS, and ROTCE excluding the $725mm increase to the FDIC special assessment are presented as non-GAAP measures. This exclusion increased net income from $13.4B to $14.0B, EPS from $4.44 to $4.63, and ROTCE from 21% to 22%.
Tangible common equity (TCE), return on tangible common equity (ROTCE), and tangible book value per share (TBVPS) are non-GAAP financial measures used to assess the Firm's use of equity.
Adjusted expense and adjusted overhead ratio are non-GAAP financial measures that exclude Firmwide legal expenses to provide an alternate presentation of the Firm's performance.
As of March 31, 2024, CET1 capital and Total Loss-Absorbing Capacity reflected the final remaining $720mm CECL benefit.
Total excess high-quality liquid assets (HQLA) represent the average eligible unencumbered liquid assets in excess of what is required to meet estimated net cash outflows over a 30-day stress period.
The 1Q23 prior-period amount for HQLA has been revised to conform with the current presentation, which uses end-of-period HQLA and unencumbered marketable securities.

Notes for Slide 4 (Consumer & Community Banking) clarify that active mobile customers are users who logged in within the past 90 days (excluding First Republic), and firmwide mortgage origination volumes are provided for recent quarters.

Notes for Slide 5 (Corporate & Investment Bank) clarify that client deposits pertain to Payments and Securities Services businesses, and that loans held-for-sale are excluded when calculating the net charge-off rate.

Notes for Slide 6 (Commercial Banking) detail a revenue reclassification from payments to investment banking in 3Q23, explain the inclusion of gross revenues from revenue-sharing arrangements, and define how certain loan types are treated for calculations.
